headline: Catholic Diocese of Cleveland raises more than $1.5M for tuition assistance at Alleluia Ball
author: Camryn Justice
sentences: Starting the gala with a special Mass, attendees later enjoyed dinner and drinks before hearing from guest speaker Kevin Stefanski, head coach of the Cleveland Browns, and getting treated with entertainment including an appearance by Frankie Avalon and other live music.

CLEVELAND â€” The Catholic Diocese of Cleveland celebrated its 175th anniversary in a special way, raising more than $1.5 million for Catholic school tuition assistance during its annual Alleluia Ball Saturday evening at Hilton Cleveland Downtown.

With 38,312 students in Catholic schools across the eight-county Catholic Diocese of Cleveland, raising funding for the Cleveland Diocese Tuition Assistance Program is an important mission for the organization.

Mike DeWine and his wife Fran were also in attendance Saturday night.
On Saturday, an estimated $1,558,000 was raised at the Alleluia Ball.
